intro: Sinningia muscicola, commonly known as the muscicola gloxinia, is a species of flowering plant in the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to the humid, shaded understory of the Amazon rainforest in South America. The plant is characterized by its dark green, velvety leaves and striking, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. It is a perennial herb that thrives in moist, well-drained soil and partial shade. Sinningia muscicola is popular among collectors for its ornamental value and unique appearance.
